data.title: Blake Quattlebaum
meta_keywords: something interesting for the keywords here
data.meta_description:
Blake Binford Quattlebaum, 54, of Savannah, GA passed away on June 19, 2020.

Born on March 23, 1966 in Birmingham, Alabama, Blake was blessed to grow up on t
data.text:
In my prayers

- Backus, St Simons Island, Ga

sincerest condolences to Robyn, Jane and Biza. To Tia and the kids, I pray for you all for peace and comfort......we Elliott's have always loved the Quattlebaums.

- Angie Elliott Thompson, Athens, GA

Condolences to all of you. Blake was a fine man, a true advocate of nature and animals. Tia, we are all so sorry and will be praying for for you, the children and all of this family. Ozzi sends his love and comfort as well.

- Pamela Kitchell, Savannah, GA

Tia, I am so very sorry. My heart hurts for you.

- Chris Thompson, Savannah, GA

Blake was a great friend and my absolute rock at the salon , I couldn’t have done it without him . I will miss him . My heart goes out to Tia, his children and the wonderful Quattlebaum family❤️

- Rene Green , Savannah , Ga

I was so shocked to hear about Blake. I still am in shock really. He was such a wonderful person. Blake helped me with my dog Jezebel. She absolutely loved him. And I guess I didn’t realize until I heard the news how much he meant to me too. I had talked to Blake in April and I knew he had been battling issues with his liver. I just did not expect to hear this news. I think of Blake as a strong person. I know he loved his family (especially his children) and he loved animals. I am so very sorry for your loss. You are all in my prayers.

- kelly deal, Savannah, Ga

Dear Tia, I'm so sorry to hear about Blake. You all are in my thoughts and prayers.

- AMANDA DELOACH, Pooler, GA

Robyn, Biza and family, I didn’t know Blake well, but having known Robyn for over 30 years, I know how much family means to him. All of you are in our thoughts and prayers. Diane and Michael Biggs.

- Diane Rousakis Biggs, Savannah, GA

Thank you for sharing this beautiful photo of Blake. Love to his family

- Blanche

Jim and I are so sorry for the loss of this sweet man. Our condolences and prayers are with the entire family. Dee and Jim King

- Diane King, SAVANNAH, GA

Tia, I am so shocked and saddened at the news of Blake's passing! You and Blake's family will be in my thoughts and prayers. God bless you all! Melanie

- Melanie Rogers, Savannah, GA

A candle has been lit!

- Debbie Coolidge, Savannah, Georgia

A candle has been lit!

So sorry for your loss to the entire Quattlebaum Family

- Jim and Karen Blakewood, Savannah, Ga

May God hold Blake’s Spirit in the palm of His hand.

- Richard, Ann Lutz and Family , Savannah , GA

Robyn, my thoughts & prayers are with all of your family at this time. May you experience God's comforting presence. Warm regards, Lorelei Faucette (Cameron's aunt)

- Lorelei Faucette, Savannah, Georgia

A candle has been lit!

It hurts so much because we LOVE so much.

- Cheryl Luce Peacock, Marble, NC

I am so sorry Tia for your loss you are in our prayers

- Mickey and Ann Langford, Rincon, GA

Blake was one of a kind and we will all miss his big smile. My sincerest condolences and much Love to you all.

- Stacey Stevenson , Savannah , Ga

We are praying fervently for all of you... sending you much love and big hugs ... May God wrap his loving arms around you all!

- Vince and Rachel Charfauros , Columbia , Sc

George and Dawn We are so sorry for your loss. Prayers for comfort and peace for your family.

- Trish and Jimmy Caparelli , Savannah , Ga

May God wrap his loving arms around you all. Drayton, I am praying for you and love you so much.

- Erin Demers, Beaufort , South Carolina

Prayers to the family. Blake will be missed his big heart for all of his and other pets was large. RIP my friend

- Christine Green, Savannah, GA

Met Blake during the Armstrong years, always enjoyed his candor and sense of humor!! Always held him with high regard!! His family has my deepest sympathies, prayers of peace during this time! Rest now Blake!

- Lisa Bowers Jenkins, Fort Mill, SC

God bless all of you Quattlebaums, y'all are well-known and liked by many people, and for good reason. I've known you all since we were little kids growing up on Isle of Hope. I remember our years together on the swim team. I was so shocked to hear of Blake's passing. I pray for your comfort. We will all miss Blake, he was a straight-up, stand-up, guy.

- Steve Christiansen, Savannah, GA

Our thoughts and prayers are with the family. Very sad to hear this news. ♥️ you Tia!

- Angela Spates, Garden City, Ga

We are so sorry Tia, lots of love and prayers for you, Blake’s children, and your families.

- The Peacock & Dean Families, Guyton, Ga

Every time Blake went to Wormsloe with his hawk he made hundreds of people so happy, my prayers with you all in this difficult time

- Jesse Wuest, Denver , CO

Our thoughts and prayers are with you at this very difficult time

- Mike & Nancy West, Tybee Island, Ga.

Jane, Biza, and Fall Quattlebaum and family, I didn’t know Blake but heard mention of him a lot, my thoughts and prayers go out to you and your family. May Blake RIP.

- Karen Droste, Savannah, GA

We were saddened to hear about the loss of your brother, Robyn. Our deepest sympathies to you and your family on your loss. May his memory be eternal.

- Crystal and Steve Nelson, Palm Coast, FL

Blake was the only person in Savannah that could handle our German Shepherd, Magnum. During Magnum's many visits he became a member and protector of their family. True friends are very difficult to find and Blake was one of those and will be deeply missed, especially by Magnum. So long Blake from Magnum, Matt, Ingrid, Parla, Parker and Cole.

- Matt Parker, Lagrange, Georgia

A candle has been lit!

I didn't know Blake, but George and Dawn (my cousin) are my close relatives. I am so sorry for your loss and prayers and God's embrace in the families time of need is sent.

- glenda hilton, Willow, AK

What beautiful heartfelt words for a man I never met but feel I know quite well. Prayer's for his loving family. So sorry!

- Joe E Anderson, Hinesville, GA

Robyn,Jane,George,Biza,Drayton,Bryanand Mrs Quattlebaum please know you are in my thoughts and prayers! I’m still in shock about Blake! He was one of my oldest friends and a truly great guy. I believe we met in a tidal creek when he was 7 and I was 5. He pulled the biggest alligator snapping turtle I have ever seen out of that creek/drainage ditch! The turtle went to the Quattlebaum Zoo (ie their backyard on the bluff) and Blake and I became friends that day! I find solace in one thing that is certain, that Blake was in the palm of God’s hand at least a full hour before the devil knew he was gone! Godspeed to all of the Quattlebaums and extended family!

- Tom Doolan, Savannah , GA

So sorry he was a wonderful friend ans family man and is going to be greatly missed God bless the family. In our prayers

- Kim U Feus, Savannah , Georgia

Sending much love and prayers to all of you. So very sorry for your loss.

- Ellen Adams

Oh Tia. My heart hurts for you and your family. Sending hugs, love and prayers!

- Angela Giroux Watson, Ellabell, GA

My deepest condolences.

- Julian Quattlebaum , Hawthorne , CA

My condolences to Tia and all the family. Blake would and will always have a seat at my table. RIP my brother!

- Mark DeShano (Shark), Nashville, TN

My friend Tia, I am extremely sorry for your loss!!! Praying for you!!!!

- Amanda Austin, Savannah, GA

Tia, Robyn & Michelle - I am so sorry to hear of Blake's passing. You are in my thoughts and prayers.

- Joy Gellatly, Guyton, GA

Tia and family, sending my heartfelt condolences to you, your children, your parents and all who knew and loved Blake. Prayers for the days, weeks, months and years ahead as God comforts.

- Marie, Pooler, Ga

Your thoughts and prayers are with us ❤️.

- The Williams Family, Savannah , Georgia

Our thoughts and prayers are with you ❤️.*

- The Williams Family, Savannah , Georgia

Tia, I was so shocked to hear of Blake's passing. You and your family are in my prayers. May God comfort you and give you peace at this time of sorrow. Love, Mrs. Nancy

- Nancy Sharpe DeLoach, Savannah, Georgia

I am so sorry for y’all’s loss. I will never forget Blake and all the laughs he has given me and shared w me throughout the years. Thank you for always looking out for me, Blake!

- Shannon Spofford, Virginia Beach , VA

You’re in our thoughts and prayers.

- John and Barbara McGinty, Savannah, GA

To the Quattlebaum Family: My deepest condolences to all of you on the loss of such a treasured husband, father, son, brother and so much more. May you find peace and comfort in God and in each other. My prayers are with all of you. With love, Jeanne Hungerpiller

- Jeanne Hungerpiller, Savannah, GA

I am so sorry for your loss Tia...I will be praying for you...

- Dena Rodewolt

So very sad to hear about Blake. We did not know him very well but always bumped into him here there and everywhere and always said “Hi”. Always had a smile on his face and was such a friendly good spirited guy. He will be missed. May God hold his family in the palm of his hand and comfort them in their time of need.

- Lynn & Jody Pyles, Savannah, GA

Jane and family- sending our deepest condolences. Praying for you all.

- Kim & Craig Ziolkowski, Savannah, GA

My deepest condolences to Blake’s family and friends. I remember Blake from childhood when I attended St. Thomas. To Jane and Robyn, I am so very sorry for your loss.

- Suzanne (Boodie) Stewart Moccia, Atlanta , Ga

Our dear friends. We are so incredibly sorry to hear of Blake’s passing. I have so many fun memories of Blake as a teenager and have thought of him so often over the years. Your family has meant so much to us - even though our time together I’m Savannah was much too short - each one of you left permanent impressions on our hearts. Praying for your family as you say goodbye to Blake and we hope you find peace in knowing that he is in Jesus’ arms now - waiting to see you all again when you go home.

- The Forester Family (Shannon, Sally and Jerry), New Braunfels, TX

Tia , we are praying for you. Blake was such a nice and pleasant man the times that we were around him. I pray that you will feel our Saviors loving arms around you. We love you, TJ, Sara, and Isabella Grace Newman

- Sara Coleman Newman, Statesboro, Georgia

Robyn, deepest condolences on the loss of your brother. He was an extraordinary man. Please know you and the family will be in our thoughts and prayers in the days to come. Love in Christ, Jerry and Heidi Starr

- Jerry and Heidi Starr, Columbus, GA

Our family will miss Blake greatly. He was such a blessing to us, taking care of our Gracie and Oliver. Praying for his special family during this deep valley, assured that God has Blake right in the palm of his hands.

- Barbara and Dwight Feemster, Savannah, GA

My deepest condolences to Tia, all the family and the many, many friends of Blake. Sending Prayers for all. So very sad.

- Tracy Harris, Asheville, NC

Tia, I'm so very sorry for your loss. May God wrap his arms around you, shield you, comfort you as only He can, and give you an extra measure of grace as you go through the days and weeks ahead. You are very much loved.

- Joseph DeLoach, San Antonio, TX

Jane and Family, I want to express my condolences. You are in my prayers and thoughts.

- Gail Hawthorne, Pooler, GA

A candle has been lit!

I only just recently heard of Blake's departure to be with the Lord. I was not only shocked but deeply saddened by the news. I love that the family requested trees be planted in his honor. Blake would have loved that. Maybe he spoke with them about this before his passing. I planted another Drake Elm my yard so I can watch it grow to be a beautiful reminder of how much Blake enjoyed the outdoors. I know his always loving family will miss him every day but I know they can have some peace in knowing that their loved one is most definitely in heaven.

- Traci Sweetin, Springfield, GA
